accessibility.title: Accessibility Preferences

theme_hints.high-contrast: Maximum contrast, large targets, bold text
theme_hints.tea: Calm colors, predictable layout, no surprise elements
theme_hints.low-vision: Extra-large text, bold weight, high contrast
theme_hints.hearing: Visual indicators for all audio cues

accessibility.cognitive_description: Monitor the cognitive complexity of generated content. Our 3-factor heuristic evaluates UI density, reading level, and interaction count.

sign_language.subtitle: Libras gesture recognition and VLibras translation
sign_language.no_result: Capture a gesture to see the result.
sign_language.gestures_note: MVP: 4 basic Libras gestures (hello, thank you, yes, no).
sign_language.vlibras_description: The VLibras widget translates selected text on the page into Brazilian Sign Language (Libras) using a 3D avatar. Select any text on the page to see the translation.
sign_language.error_not_allowed: Camera access denied. Check your browser permissions.
sign_language.error_not_supported: Video capture not supported in this browser.
sign_language.captioning_description: Real-time translation of sign language gestures to text.
sign_language.captioning_no_signs: No signs detected yet. Start captioning and sign in front of the camera.
sign_language.continuous_description: Real-time sign language recognition from your webcam feed.
sign_language.webcam_sr_instructions: Use the Start Camera button to enable your webcam. Once the camera is active, use Start Captioning to begin real-time sign language recognition. Signs will be translated to text below the video feed.

simulate.title: Empathy Bridge
simulate.description: Simulate how your students experience the content. Activate one or more simulations to understand their perspectives.
simulate.active_simulations: {count} simulation(s) active. The page may look different than normal.

modes.protanopia_desc: Difficulty distinguishing red from green. Affects ~1% of males. Red appears as yellowish-green.
modes.deuteranopia_desc: Most common form of color blindness. Affects ~6% of males. Green is confused with red.
modes.tritanopia_desc: Difficulty distinguishing blue from yellow. Rare (~0.01%). Blue appears as green.
modes.low_vision_desc: Simulates blurred vision and reduced contrast, as experienced by people with macular degeneration.
modes.tunnel_vision_desc: Visual field restricted to the center, as experienced by people with glaucoma or retinitis pigmentosa.
modes.dyslexia_desc: Scrambled letters simulate reading difficulty. Affects ~5-10% of the population.
modes.motor_difficulty_desc: Cursor delay simulates tremor and fine motor control difficulty.

guide.page_subtitle: Everything you need to know about AiLine, organized by your role. Select your perspective below to get started.

teacher.heading: Teacher Guide
teacher.intro: Learn how to create AI-powered inclusive lesson plans, manage student profiles, review AI-generated content, and monitor progress across your classroom.
teacher.getting_started_desc:
Begin by uploading your teaching materials in the Materials section. You can upload documents, worksheets, or any reference content that the AI will use to generate lesson plans.
Next, navigate to Plans and use the creation wizard. Enter the subject, grade level, and select an accessibility profile. The AI will generate a fully adapted lesson plan in under 60 seconds.
Your first plan will include a Teacher Plan (full details), a Student Plan (simplified view), quality report, and up to 10 export variants for different learning needs.
teacher.pipeline_desc:
AiLine uses a transparent AI pipeline with Glass Box visibility. Every step is shown in real-time so you always know what the AI is doing.
The pipeline flows through four stages: Planner (generates the initial plan), Quality Gate (scores and validates against curriculum standards), Executor (produces the final adapted version), and optional Refinement (if the quality score is below threshold).
The Smart Router automatically selects the best AI model (Claude, GPT, or Gemini) based on task complexity, token count, and cost optimization. You can see the routing decision in the pipeline panel.
teacher.student_profiles_desc:
AiLine supports comprehensive accessibility profiles for diverse learning needs. When creating a plan, choose from: ASD (Autism Spectrum) for calm colors, predictable layouts, and visual schedules; ADHD for focus mode, chunked activities, and reduced distractions; Dyslexia for bionic reading, wide spacing, and warm tones; and Hearing Impairment for sign language support, captions, and visual indicators.
Each profile automatically adapts the generated content, layout, typography, and interaction patterns. The platform applies evidence-based accessibility research to every adaptation.
teacher.reviewing_desc:
After the AI generates a plan, it appears in your review queue. You can Approve the plan (it becomes available to students), Request Revision (the AI will refine specific areas), or Reject it (start over with different parameters).
The Quality Report shows a detailed score breakdown including structural checks, curriculum alignment, accessibility adaptations, and improvement suggestions. The Trust panel provides full transparency into AI reasoning.
You can also edit any section directly before approving. Your changes are preserved alongside the AI-generated content.
teacher.monitoring_desc:
The Progress dashboard shows a standards-based heatmap of mastery levels across your class. Each student's progress is tracked against curriculum standards (BNCC, Common Core, or NGSS).
Mastery levels range from Not Started through Developing, Proficient, to Mastered. The system automatically identifies students who may need additional support based on their progress trajectory.
Record progress after tutor sessions or assessments to keep the tracking up to date. The AI uses this data to personalize future lesson plans.
teacher.tutoring_desc:
Set up personalized AI tutors for each student. The tutor uses the Socratic method by default, guiding students through questions rather than giving direct answers.
Tutors support voice input (speak your question), visual diagrams (Mermaid charts generated on the fly), and read-aloud functionality. Each session adapts to the student's accessibility profile automatically.
After each session, review the conversation transcript. You can flag specific messages for quality review and see a session summary with standards coverage and recommended next steps.
teacher.exports_desc:
Every plan can be exported in 10 different formats to serve diverse learning needs:
1. Teacher Plan - Complete instructional guide with objectives, activities, and assessments
2. Student Plan - Simplified version with clear steps and visual cues
3. Visual Schedule - Card-based visual timeline ideal for ASD/ADHD
4. Simplified Version - Reduced complexity with core concepts only
5. High Contrast - Enhanced visibility for low vision
6. Audio Script - Text optimized for text-to-speech
7. Sign Language - Content structured for sign language interpretation
8. Parent Guide - Plain-language summary for families
9. Assessment - Evaluation rubrics and check-for-understanding tools
10. Curriculum Map - Standards alignment visualization

student.heading: Student Guide
student.intro: Your learning experience is personalized just for you. Here is how to make the most of AiLine's AI tutor, accessibility features, and progress tracking.
student.your_tutor_desc:
The AI tutor is your personal learning companion. You can ask questions by typing or using voice input (click the microphone icon). The tutor will guide you through problems step by step.
The tutor creates visual diagrams to help explain complex concepts. If you do not understand something, just ask again in a different way, and the tutor will adapt its explanation.
Your conversations are saved so you can review them later. Each session ends with a summary of what you covered and suggested next steps.
student.a11y_features_desc:
AiLine adapts to your learning needs automatically. Depending on your profile, you may see different visual themes, typography, and interaction patterns.
Key features include: Focus Mode (highlights the active section, dims everything else), Bionic Reading (bolds the first part of words for faster scanning), Visual Schedules (step-by-step cards instead of long text), and Read Aloud (text-to-speech for any content).
You can switch between 9 accessibility personas at any time using the persona toggle in the top bar. Each persona changes colors, spacing, font size, and layout to match specific needs.
student.your_progress_desc:
Your mastery is tracked across curriculum standards. As you complete tutor sessions and assessments, your progress updates automatically.
Mastery levels are: Not Started (you have not covered this topic yet), Developing (you are learning the basics), Proficient (you understand the concept well), and Mastered (you can apply the concept confidently).
The progress view shows a visual heatmap so you can quickly see your strengths and areas that need more practice.
student.getting_help_desc:
The AI tutor uses the Socratic method by default. This means it will ask you guiding questions to help you discover the answer yourself. Research shows this leads to deeper understanding.
If you are stuck, you can ask the tutor to explain more directly. Just say something like "Can you explain this step by step?" or "I need more help with this part."
If you encounter any issues with accessibility or the platform, let your teacher know. They can adjust your profile settings and review your tutor sessions.

parent.heading: Parent Guide
parent.intro: Stay informed about your child's learning journey. AiLine provides clear, jargon-free reports and full transparency into how AI supports your child's education.
parent.reports_desc:
Progress reports are written in plain language so you can understand exactly how your child is doing. Reports include mastery levels for each topic, time spent learning, and areas where your child excels or needs support.
The Quality Scorecard shows how the AI adapted the lesson plan for your child, including reading level adjustments, accessibility adaptations, and curriculum standards alignment.
Reports are generated automatically after tutor sessions and assessments. You can view them at any time in the Progress section.
parent.child_plan_desc:
Lesson plans are created by your child's teacher and enhanced by AI to match your child's learning profile. If your child has a specific learning need (such as autism, ADHD, dyslexia, or hearing impairment), the AI automatically adapts content, layout, and teaching strategies.
The Parent Guide export variant is specifically designed for families. It summarizes what your child is learning, the adaptations made, and how you can support at home.
You can compare the standard version with the adapted version to see exactly what changes the AI made and why.
parent.support_home_desc:
Each lesson plan includes suggested activities you can do at home to reinforce what your child is learning at school. These activities are adapted to your child's learning profile.
Key strategies include: maintaining consistent routines (especially important for ASD), breaking tasks into small chunks (helpful for ADHD), using multisensory approaches (beneficial for dyslexia), and providing visual supports (essential for hearing impairment).
The AI tutor is also available at home. Your child can continue learning at their own pace with the same personalized experience they have at school.
parent.privacy_desc:
AiLine takes data privacy seriously and complies with FERPA (US) and LGPD (Brazil) regulations. Your child's data is encrypted at rest and in transit.
Data retention policies: study plans are kept for 365 days, tutor sessions for 90 days, uploaded materials for 180 days, and usage logs for 30 days. You can export or delete all data at any time from the Privacy panel.
The AI processes data in real-time and does not retain conversation context between sessions. No student data is used to train AI models. All AI decisions are logged for transparency and can be reviewed by teachers.

setup.title: Setup AiLine
setup.subtitle: Configure your open-source inclusive learning platform
setup.welcome_desc: AiLine is an open-source platform for adaptive inclusive education. Let's configure your instance in a few steps.
setup.ai_desc: Choose your primary LLM provider and enter your API key.
setup.provider_anthropic_desc: Claude models — excellent reasoning and instruction following
setup.provider_gemini_desc: Gemini models — strong multimodal and long context
setup.provider_openrouter_desc: Unified gateway to 200+ models from all providers
setup.embed_desc: Choose the embedding model for semantic search (RAG). This setting is permanent.
setup.embed_warning: Embedding dimensions cannot be changed after setup. The vector database columns are created with the chosen dimensions. To change later, you would need to recreate the database and re-embed all content.
setup.models_desc: Configure which AI model each agent uses. Defaults work well for most cases.
setup.agent_planner_desc: Plans inclusive lesson content and structure
setup.agent_executor_desc: Generates the final adapted lesson plan
setup.agent_quality_desc: Scores and validates plans against standards
setup.infra_desc: Database and Redis connection settings. Pre-filled with Docker Compose defaults.
setup.security_desc: JWT authentication and optional media service keys.
setup.jwt_secret_placeholder: A strong secret for JWT token signing
setup.restart_hint: Restart your Docker Compose to apply changes:

classroom.title: Inclusive Classroom Mode
classroom.subtitle: One Lesson, Four Adapted Plans
classroom.description: See how one lesson plan adapts for four unique learners, each with different needs.
classroom.student_lucas_adaptation: Visual schedule with calm colors and predictable step-by-step layout
classroom.student_lucas_snippet: Step 1: Watch the 2-minute video about photosynthesis (visual timer shown). Step 2: Match the diagram labels using drag-and-drop cards. Step 3: Draw your own plant cycle diagram.
classroom.student_sofia_adaptation: Chunked activities with built-in timers and focus mode enabled
classroom.student_sofia_snippet: Activity 1 (5 min): Quick quiz — name 3 things plants need. Activity 2 (7 min): Read the short passage, highlighted key words. Activity 3 (8 min): Complete the worksheet in pairs.
classroom.student_pedro_adaptation: Bionic reading with wide spacing and warm background tones
classroom.student_pedro_snippet: Photosynthesis is how plants make food. They use sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide. The process happens in the leaves. Chlorophyll gives leaves their green color.
classroom.student_ana_adaptation: Sign language glosses, visual captions, and vibration-based alerts
classroom.student_ana_snippet: VIDEO: [Captions enabled] Plants use sunlight to make food. ACTIVITY: Match pictures to words (no audio required). ASSESSMENT: Draw and label the photosynthesis cycle.

evidence.title: AI Evidence & Transparency
evidence.rag_description: Percentage of content backed by uploaded teaching materials and curriculum databases
